data.scheme_name: West Bengal Textile Incentive Scheme,2022 - Stamp Duty and Registration Fee - New
data.benefits: Scheme provides a reimbursement of 100% of stamp duty and registration fee on Land/building/ shed taken on Lease.
data.eligibility: Units involved in the manufacturing and processing of textiles, apparel, and technical textiles products that commenced production on or after 1st April 2022.
data.conditions:
Reimbursement applicable for: Purchase of land/buildings for setting up the approved project. 

Lease of land/building/shed (minimum 10 years) for setting up the approved project. 

Reimbursement amount will be calculated proportionally based on land/buildings used for the approved project.
data.beneficiaries: Industries involved in the manufacturing and processing of textiles, apparel, and technical textiles products that commenced production on or after 1st April 2022.
data.prerequisites:
Reimbursement applicable for: Purchase of land/buildings for setting up the approved project. 

Lease of land/building/shed (minimum 10 years) for setting up the approved project. 

Reimbursement amount will be calculated proportionally based on land/buildings used for the approved project.
data.nodal_agency: Department of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises and Textiles
data.context: Incentivize the entire value chain from fibre to fabric across the entire eco-system of the Textile Sector which is one of the highest employment generators; therefore, to provide fiscal benefit to the entire value chain of the textile sector of the state, the Governor is pleased to sanction the implementation of a new Incentive Scheme for Textile Sector in West Bengal.
data.objective:
To provide fiscal incentives to industries in the textile sector.
To encourage the establishment and expansion of such units within the state.
To encourage the establishment and expansion of units within the state. 
Rapid and targeted development of the textile sector throughout the state, aiming to optimize resource utilization, create new employment opportunities, and position the state as the preferred investment destination in the textile industry.
data.description:
Scheme provides : 

Reimbursement : 100% of stamp duty and registration fee paid for document registration. 

Eligible Purposes : 

i. Purchase of land/buildings for the approved project. 

ii. Lease of land/building/shed (minimum 10 years) for the approved project. 

Reimbursement Calculation : Proportional to the percentage of land/buildings used for the project.
data.how_to_apply: The Applicant can apply through:- https://textiles.wb.gov.in/register
data.funding_facilitator: Department of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises and Textiles
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get incentive after the approval of the application by the concerned authority.
data.additional_info: Textile units in MSME sector will have the option to apply either under this scheme or under  “Banglashree” Scheme, 2020.
data.checklist_info_a:
1.A copy of the Memorandum of Association and Articles of Association authenticated by the Registrar of Companies/ Registered partnership deed (wherever applicable)
2. A certified statement from ROC or any other competent authority on the name and address of the Directors / Partners/Owners of the industry in the manufacturing sector of textile /Members of Cooperative or Self-Help Groups, as applicable.
3. Copy of approved project report (As defined in the Gazette notification of WBTIS2022)
4. A copy of loan sanction letter issued by financial institutions/banks.
5. A copy of audited balance sheet for last 2years wherever applicable.
6. A list of plant and machinery with original value along with copies of the bills, money receipts, way bills and challans.
7. Existing manufacturing activities in West Bengal stating Items, annual approved capacity, annual
production during last two years (in quantity and value in Rs. Lakh), for expansion project.
8. Copy of the land deed (wherever applicable). In case of rented /leasehold land/buildings, copy of rent
agreement and receipt /lease agreement.
9. Copy of mutation & conversion certificate of land /buildings, wherever applicable.
10. Copy of valid consent to operate certificate from the WBPCB.
11. Copy of trade licence.
12. Copy of first electricity bill(wherever applicable)
13. Copy of acknowledgement of Udyam Reg./IEM(B).

Additional Docs:
1.For State Capital Investment Subsidy
Auditor’s/ Chartered Accountant’s Certificate for utilization of fund.
A certificate from a Chartered Accountant as per Annexure II
A certificate in respect of fixed assets as per Annexure – II.
